import React, { useRef } from 'react'; function Projects() { const projectsRef = useRef(null); // Scroll by width of 3 items (300px per item) const scrollProjects = (direction) => { const container = projectsRef.current; const scrollAmount = 3 * 320; // 3 items, each 300px + 20px gap if (direction === 'left') { container.scrollBy({ left: -scrollAmount, behavior: 'smooth', }); } else { container.scrollBy({ left: scrollAmount, behavior: 'smooth', }); } }; return (

Projects

The code repository for my portfolio website can be accessed by clicking the button below.

GitHub Repo

The following are the projects that I've been involved in over the years:

{/* Project 1 */}

Music Subscription App | HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP, AWS (S3, DynamoDB, EC2)

A dynamic web application created with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP, hosted on AWS EC2. The app uses DynamoDB for user authentication and registration. AWS S3 is used for scalable image storage.

The design focuses on performance, scalability, and cross-browser compatibility.

Video Demo
{/* Project 2 */}

Vacuum Cleaner Game | C++

Developed a vacuum cleaner game in C++ using OOP principles with a command-line interface. The game uses a 10x10 grid and allows players to navigate using text-based commands.

Video Demo
{/* Project 3 */}

Minecraft Village Generator | Python

A procedural Minecraft village generator in Python using the MCPI library. The project employs recursion for dynamically generating rooms within houses and connects them with pathways, generating trees to enhance the village's appearance.

GitHub Repo Video Demo
{/* Project 4 */}

Closing The Gap | Java, HTML, CSS, SQL

Developed a web app to highlight socio-economic disparities between Indigenous and non-Indigenous populations in Australia. The backend used Java with Javalin and SQLite for efficient data management. The frontend, built with HTML and CSS, features responsive design and dynamic data visualizations to compare various socio-economic factors.


Video Demo
{/* Project 5 */}

Rock Paper Scissors | JavaScript, HTML, CSS

Built a simple interactive rock-paper-scissors game using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The game allows users to select their choice and play against a computer-generated opponent. JavaScript handles the game logic, while HTML and CSS manage the layout and styling.


Github Repo App
{/* Project 6 */}

Facebook Metrics Analysis | Python, NumPy, Matplotlib, Pandas, Jupyter Notebook

Analyzed a Facebook dataset of posts from a cosmetics brand in 2014. The project used Python, Pandas, and Matplotlib for data cleaning, exploratory analysis, and visualization of post performance. Jupyter Notebook was used for documenting and sharing findings with the team.


GitHub Repo Report
); } export default Projects;
